definition: to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
day/sky/heaven
wine (esp. rice wine)/liquor/spirits/alcoholic beverage/CL:杯[bei1],瓶[ping2],罐[guan4],桶[tong3],缸[gang1]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: He died in his late thirties as he ruined his constitution by drink and dissipation.
sentences.chinese: 他不到四十歲就死了，花天酒地的生活毀了他的身體。

sentences.english: The Chinese news media often report on the flashy lives that many soccer players apparently lead.
sentences.chinese: 中國媒體常常報道男足球員的花天酒地的生活。

sentences.english: He was helling around when in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 在歐洲期間，他一直過着花天酒地的生活。

sentences.english: His wife used to racket about when she was young.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子年輕時經常過着花天酒地的生活。

sentences.english: And then you come in and spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends?
sentences.chinese: 你纔回來陪了我們幾秒鐘，就要出去跟朋友花天酒地？

sentences.english: The world is racketing around at an ever madder pace.
sentences.chinese: 她一直與大富翁爲伴，過着花天酒地的生活。

sentences.english: He hates the racket of modem life.
sentences.chinese: 他討厭過現代生活中那種花天酒地的生活。

sentences.english: These playboys riot in dissipated living.
sentences.chinese: 這些花花公子整天沉湎於花天酒地的放蕩生活。

sentences.english: What these parasites cared about was nothing but drinking and helling around.
sentences.chinese: 這些寄生蟲所關心的無非就是花天酒地。

sentences.english: What he cared about was  helling around.
To go it, where is a place like Paris?
sentences.chinese: 要過花天酒地的生活，哪裏還有像巴黎那樣的地方。

definition: lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
extravagance/extravagant
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
to hang around/to fool around/to live aimlessly
to idle about
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
extravagant and dissipated/decadent
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
to enjoy life/pleasures of life
hedonistic son of rich parents
to visit a prostitute
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
to hang out together with (derog.)/to mix with
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
